alert.note: Alert for Orange (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 14 at 8:09AM PST until December 14 at 12:30PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the following county, Orange. * WHEN...Until 1215 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 809 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Irvine, Mission Viejo, San Clemente, Laguna Beach, Dana Point, Newport Beach, Laguna Niguel, Rancho Santa Margarita, Aliso Viejo, San Juan Capistrano, Laguna Woods, El Toro, Las Flores, Foothill Ranch, Trabuco Canyon, Silverado, Ortega Highway, Newport Coast, San Joaquin Hills and Laguna Hills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
